website_summaries.verdict: Soft and heart-shaped to make them more comfortable and less visible under your shirt.
pros: Daytime pads are thin, but very absorbent
Includes a backing to keep from leaking
Comes with thin ones for the day and thick ones for overnight
Wick moisture better than other pads
cons: It can be hard to get these pads to lie flat

customer_reviews.title: Soft and comfortable, catches leaks
customer_reviews.text: Breastfeeding can be hard, especially when you're first getting started. The last thing you need is dealing with embarrassing milk leaks all over your top. These nursing pads are great! Very soft and comfortable, and much gentler on sensitive skin than the harsh itchy disposable pads. I don't have to make any adjustments during the day, as they don't bunch up in weird spots or shift when you change positions. They're also easy to clean; I just put mine in a mesh garment bag on the gentle cycle and they come out looking good as new.
customer_reviews.author: KvotheTop Contributor: Cooking

customer_reviews.title: Soft but not as absorbent as I’d like.
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to love these but they are just ok. They are very soft so a pro but cons are the heart shaped ones curl up after washing and don’t hold much liquid. Thankfully I don’t soak through pads but if I did the hearts would leak. I even leaked out of the overnight wearing it during the day when I was oversupplying. The softness helps when nipples are sore, but for the price I wouldn’t buy these again. I invested in my other brand Kindred Bravely that hold way more before leaking. The whole pad has to be soaked to leak with those.
customer_reviews.author: Darcy Larson

customer_reviews.title: Poor absorbency- skin itches!
customer_reviews.text: I remember buying these back in 2011 when I had my first baby. They were much more absorbent!! The hearts also did not roll up after washing and drying. These are almost a joke. After letdown, the hearts are totally soaked! The so-called overnight ones are not much more absorbent. Only good thing is that these conceal extremely well!!! Other than that, probably returning them as my skin itches after these get soaked. I have tried another brand that claims 100% bamboo material and it doesn't cause my skin to itch.
customer_reviews.author: Clearblueskies

customer_reviews.title: Contains Leaks and Very Soft
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product. I prefer the nighttime pads for daytime as well as they are great girls containing leaks. The daytime heart shaped ones are great too! The shape of them gives you a nice profile -no bunching at all. Overall great product if you have a bigger milk supply and leak a lot. Especially if you are early postpartum and sensitive and sore from breastfeeding- the softness feels amazing.
customer_reviews.author: Jacinta

customer_reviews.title: Soft and durable
customer_reviews.text: I love the softness of these and they wash really well. I have leaked through them a few times but mainly because they move around inside my bra and I don’t realize it in time to fix it. I wish they were a little bigger - I think they wouldn’t move around as much if they were. Overall great product, I would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Brittany Schwartz

customer_reviews.title: Skip this product
customer_reviews.text: Like other reviewers I like the circle pads but hate the heart shaped ones. They roll up after a wash and don’t fit well at all. I also don’t love the fabric they’re made out of. My milk tends to stick the fabric to my nipple making for a painful removal and fibers stuck to my nipples. Also, as another reviewer said they get soggy and gross if you really leak into them and you have to change them once they’re wet or you’re sitting in that moisture. I wear them when I don’t think I’ll leak but want to feel secure, but not when I actually expect to have leaking. Disposable ones are much better for keeping you dry.
customer_reviews.author: Mellany Shipton

customer_reviews.title: Soft, breathable, and holds a lot overnight!
customer_reviews.text: Love these! I had been using disposable pads but I noticed my nursing bras and tanks looked wrinkly in the breast. I bought these on a whim and I absolutely love them. Overnight they hold so much more than the disposables, they are so much softer and more breathable. And best of all- I’m not self conscious in public! I didn’t have this problem, but I’m not sure what you would do if you had a yeast infection of the breast. I don’t know if the washing machine would cut it. Or if you would have to boil them.
customer_reviews.author: casey

customer_reviews.title: I love this product
customer_reviews.text: I love this product. I used with my first child and now with second. I wouldn't use another brand. The material is so soft, even after washed several times it does not further agitate sore or chafed nipples. It holds in quite a bit of leakage so you don't have to worry about public embarasement. They can move a bit especially if just wearing a tank or loose fitting bra so when out and about I make sure to wear a little snugger bra so that they are sure to stay in place. The price is a bit steep compared to other brands but the material quality is worth it, especially when you are sore up top.
customer_reviews.author: NetzerFamily

customer_reviews.title: Worked great! Absorbent and very soft and comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Worked great! Absorbent and very soft and comfortable, even with bleeding nipples. This pack is the perfect amount! Now for why it's not 5 stars. After putting them in the regular wash, I noticed the seams of one coming apart so since then I've put them in washing pouches, like the kind you use for bra's and underwear, and haven't noticed anymore ripping. They also tend to slip around, so I have to readjust them all the time, wish there were little grippy dots or something on the back side .....
customer_reviews.author: Kymeerox

customer_reviews.title: Room for improvement.
customer_reviews.text: These are very soft inside and comfortable to wear. It would be five stars except the do not lay completely flat in my bra and without any way to secure them inside the bra, they shift quite a bit. I prefer the overnight pads to the day pads. Both are much thinner than expected, and more comfortable than other washable pads I have tried. Update*** I dropped this review from 4 to 2 stars. These pads, both the day and night do nothing but shift in my bra all day and night--the shifting is due to the satiny back. They may work, however they are rarely in place in order TO work. I much prefer the motherease nursing pads.
customer_reviews.author: aes

customer_reviews.title: Soft, but not in love
customer_reviews.text: These are nice and soft. I like using them when my nipples are tender, but they have a couple things to improve. The bamboo is absorbent, but I have to change them frequently or the moisture irritates my breasts. Also, the shape is weird--they don't form to the shape of my breast very well--lots of lumps making it that I wouldn't want to wear these out of the house. Update: 2nd baby and I am getting more of these pads so I can change them out frequently since they really are the most comfortable pads I tried.
customer_reviews.author: KLV

customer_reviews.title: Overnight are great! Light Ones LEAK!
customer_reviews.text: I wish i bought all overnight ones! Those are great, they are big and cover a lot of space, plus they are circular. Not sure why they decided to make the light ones in a heart shape - I can never figure out which way to put them in and what works best. They leak almost immediately so I barely ever use these. They aren't much thinner than the overnight (blue) ones so I should have just gotten those!
customer_reviews.author: Lindsey Mattioli

customer_reviews.title: So thin, they're so very thin.
customer_reviews.text: This product did not work for me. I bought it from hearing rave reviews through YouTubers and was very disappointed at how thin these pads were. They would get sopping wet within minutes. I ended up buying Lanolin disposable nursing pads. I would not recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Kiem

customer_reviews.title: Wait until your milk supply is under control!!!
customer_reviews.text: This is my fifth nursing child so I thought I knew everything about nursing pads.... Not! The first week I use them I was really disappointed because I was leaking through them left and right, but it was also the first week of my sons life and that's the time or you're super engorged and leaking everywhere anyways!!!!! After I got My milk supply under control these did become my favorite nursing mothers product. They are supersoft and way nicer compare to the disposable scratchy nursing pads!!
customer_reviews.author: Estrella

customer_reviews.title: Best nursing pads I've ever tried
customer_reviews.text: Best nursing pads I've ever tried. I've tried washable and disposable before and have had leaks with both, as well as dealt with washable ones starting to feel rough. These ones stay super soft after washing and I haven't had a single leak. I used disposables for a few days while on a road trip and it wasnt fun (even with the bamboobies brand). I got back and put these on and it was literally a relief. So glad I spent extra money on these, they are so well worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Erika

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: Love these. So soft and they wash really well. I was impressed that you couldn't see them under my shirt through my bra. It is best to change them reasonably quickly if they get really moist though to prevent odors.
customer_reviews.author: Kaw1011

customer_reviews.title: Nursing must-have!
customer_reviews.text: These nursing pads are the best! They are very absorbent, even for overnight. The best part is how soft they are against your skin. My nipples had gotten so sore that even the liner of my bra irritated them. Bamboobies have solved that problem. Due to their thinness and their shape, the daytime pads won't show through even unlined bras. I throw them in the wash with my baby's clothes and they come out perfect. Definitely a must have for nursing moms. Oh, and good for the environment too!
customer_reviews.author: Amy Kirby

customer_reviews.title: You can tell when you’ve leaked
customer_reviews.text: Softer/more comfortable than disposable pads, however if you leak a lot you can feel the dampness unlike you would with a disposable pad. I tried these to be more eco-friendly but not worth it in my opinion to feel wet all day. And for the price they only give you 3 of each (night/day) which doesn’t seem like enough you’d have to wash them constantly.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I love the round overnight ones but the day time heart ...
customer_reviews.text: I love the round overnight ones but the day time heart ones don't stay in place and Are not very absorvent. I use the night ones for day time or night although at night it is not enough to keep me dry even though I started to use when my baby was 4 months. If you have a lot of milk as I do, you are better off buying disposable untill your milk production goes down. They are very comfortable. Biggest draw back is that they don't really stay in place at night!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Comfort for your girls
customer_reviews.text: Don't waste your money on anything else just buy these. I have been cluster feeding my newborn for 4 days straight now and these are heavenly pillows for when I do get a break. They do an amazing job keeping me from leaking through, much better than the disposables and the disposables rub. They are a tiny bit lumpy under a shirt but who the heck cares. They are working girls now are deserve some comfort over looks.
customer_reviews.author: AmyTop Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: Love the boobies
customer_reviews.text: I wear them at home and sometimes out and about. I can't speak on leakage because I haven't soaked through them. My one gripe is that they don't stay in place sometimes.
customer_reviews.author: MH

customer_reviews.title: Amazing!
customer_reviews.text: I was gifted a lot of different nursing pads from different friends at my baby shower as well as friends who wanted to get rid of their left over disposable pads. These were the pads I ended up using exclusively because they were so comfortable. The fabric is incredibly soft and breathes well but is also super absorbent. They are machine washable and hold up well. I nursed my son for 10 months and used these pads daily and washed them daily but they still look good as new. They are definitely worth the price since they are the only pads you will need and they seem to last forever.
customer_reviews.author: Tree hugger

customer_reviews.title: Bamboobies are the best!
customer_reviews.text: I've tried a few variety of disposable nursing pads and one kind of washable. These are definitely the best of all of them! They are super soft and wash up great. When I first washed them, I kept two pairs out of the dryer to compare how they dried, and either way works perfectly. Keep in mind, I put them in with my baby clothes, so low heat drying cycle with no fabric softener sheets. As mentioned by another reviewer, I did notice a few light fluffs on my nipples but only a couple of times. I am sure this will go away after a few washes. Love these and highly recommend them. I will be buying more!
customer_reviews.author: J. Viens

customer_reviews.title: Better than the other bamboo pads
customer_reviews.text: Love these! You may look at other cheaper bamboo nursing pads and assume you are getting the same thing... you aren’t. These are super comfortable for leaks or for wearing when applying cream or medicine. Other brands are very uncomfortable and stick to your nipple if wearing cream for sore nipples; these don’t. Washable and reusable. They’ve made it through two kids. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Amy

customer_reviews.title: Cloud Soft and Milk Proof
customer_reviews.text: You don't even realize you're wearing it till you pull out to breast feed and it's in the bra. LOL. Very comfortable, easy to clean just throw them in the wash and they still feel good as new, even softer I think. Never had a problem with them on. Definitely great buy.
customer_reviews.author: EuniDragon

customer_reviews.title: In love with Bamboobies!
customer_reviews.text: I recently discovered I was getting nipple and breast irritation from disposable nursing pads. I did some research and saw that bamboobies are great as an alternative. My baby is almost 5 months and my breast still leak at night and occasionally during the day. The bamboobies arrived the next day in the mail and I got both the regular and the overnights. I was pleasantly surprised how soft they are. I also love the size and thinness. I had bought some cheap washable nursing pads that were too thick, too small and you could see them through my bra. Bamboobies are perfect!
customer_reviews.author: mobu

customer_reviews.title: I like these generally
customer_reviews.text: I like these generally, but I wish the inside didn’t have a “direction” to the fibers of the material that lines it. If I have to readjust the Pads sometimes it’s a little too rough on the nipple. I also wish that there was a way to make them so they don’t pucker or create a line. That is very frustrating.
customer_reviews.author: Hannah

customer_reviews.title: Did not last
customer_reviews.text: I washed these as recommended and they still started to mildew. They were never put in a hamper and still somehow slowly each got ruined. I purchased these so I wouldn’t have to use disposables however they didn’t last.
customer_reviews.author: Brittany Fogle

customer_reviews.title: Soft, but don’t contain leaks.
customer_reviews.text: While these are definitely softer than disposables, they simply do not contain leaks. I have leaked through both the daytime and nighttime pads. You have to take them off and wash them once they get wet, so if you leak multiple times throughout the day, you can go through your entire set of multiple pads before the end of the day. If I plan on leaving the house or seeing friends, I wear the disposables, since they’re more reliable.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: doubtful at first, but then I was impressed
customer_reviews.text: Saw all the reviews & had to try these. Like most women, I started with disposables. Then recieved a pack of washables (another brand) and loved the idea of it. Hated the waste (& cost) of disposables... Like other reviews said: when you first see these you will think omg how will that stop leaking because of how thin they are. But trust me thats a big reason why they're so great. I am amazed at how I havent had a leak yet. The overnight ones are impressive. Love the design, shape and color, and the texture of the fabric. Will be buying more soon!
customer_reviews.author: MamaT

customer_reviews.title: Kind of good, kind of bad.
customer_reviews.text: I like how soft and thin they are. I do not like the heart shape, as I find it very awkward. Still haven't figured out the best placement for it. They seem to move around in my nursing bra quite a bit. I'm not sure what exactly is waterproof about them because I have leaked through a number of times, possibly die to them shifting around and my nipple getting too close to the edge?? Double stick tape seems to help the shifting problem.
customer_reviews.author: joseph

customer_reviews.title: Heart shape >> Circle shape
customer_reviews.text: Gave as a gift because I previously had my own sets of the same. Unlike the typical circle/oval pad, the heart shape is largely unnoticed when wearing a bra and thin shirt. They are not the most absorbent pads I have used, but they work in most situations, and are comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Hvistym

customer_reviews.title: very comfortable to wear
customer_reviews.text: I got these because I wanted to stop wasting money with disposable pads. The heart shape is cute and they catch everything that leaks. I am a heavy leaker so I have to change them half way through the day, this keeps my skin from getting irritated as these are not something that will stay dry (which is ok for me, as I just wash them!). They are small and inconspicuous, very comfortable to wear. Only thing is that they can sometime migrate in my bra, so I have to check to make sure they are in place.
customer_reviews.author: Angela M. Coleman

customer_reviews.title: Love, but...
customer_reviews.text: I looked and looked and looked for reusable boob pads that had some sort of backing to prevent leakage to my bra. These are awesome. They're insanely soft and quite absorbent. HOWEVER, if you're like me with ridiculously leaky boobs, I think it's worth it to only buy the overnight pack. The "heart" day time pads are cute, but just don't cut it for me. I also went back to disposables (without ripping off the sticky backing) because I am so leaky. But I love these for back-up, and hopefully one day will go back to them.
customer_reviews.author: Julianne Beecher

customer_reviews.title: A life saver!
customer_reviews.text: If you have hyper-sensitive or inflamed nips from nursing/pumping... these are the best thing I’ve tried. A life saver.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: Not a huge fan
customer_reviews.text: I'm all for eco friendly and everything, but these just didn't work as well as the disposables do for me. They don't lay flat in my bra, so you can see the odd lines that they make sometimes. And I almost always leaked through them. I just didn't like having to change them every few hours. They are very soft though and held shape pretty well after being washed
customer_reviews.author: Jess

customer_reviews.title: Convenient and Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: My Bamboobies nursing pads have proved to be comfortable and convenient so far. They are soft and don't chafe or itch like the disposable pads do. I also like the idea that I'm producing less waste. My nipples occasionally stick to the cloth fabric, but not very often. They are absorbent and have not leaked through the fabric. My only gripe is that they don't lie flat against my breasts - they require some creative positioning so that they don't show through a thin shirt or bra. Darting in the design would help them lie flat against the natural curve of the breast.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: The best breast pads!
customer_reviews.text: While these are a bit pricier than other breast pads they are definitely worth the investment. They're super soft, not bulky, and very absorbent. The natural bamboo fibers really do keep you from leaking through. The overnight pads are also great if you're lucky enough to have a little one who is sleeping through the night and you're not doing as many feedings. They are also great if you have sore or chaffed nipples. As a first time mommy and nurser, I've had a lot of soreness from nursing. Bamboobies made me so much more comfortable in between feedings. I would for sure recommend Bamboobies for any nursing moms out there!
customer_reviews.author: brooke radford

customer_reviews.title: Must-have for new mamas!
customer_reviews.text: Absorbs leaks well, but other breast pads do that too. What makes Bamboobies THE. BEST. is that they feel like silk on your new-mom, just-learning-to-breastfeed, cracked, sore nipples. I kid you not, other breast pads were painful to wear in the first week or so, but these felt (and still feel, 7 weeks later) so soft and comfortable. I have yet to have one leak through onto my bra, which the other brands I've tried have done. If you're breastfeeding and/or pumping, you need these!
customer_reviews.author: Mari Golden

customer_reviews.title: The overnights are the very best!
customer_reviews.text: After buying a few kinds these are my favorite nursing Pads. The overnight ones are especially awesome, but I use the thin ones for going out also. The heart shaped means they don't show at all (but you have to position them just right to avoid leaks). They are the softest if any I tried and the overnight were the only pad that worked for me overnight. Per the instructions, be sure to wash and dry on hot to avoid any mildew! I also put in a net bag so they get lots of air after use.
customer_reviews.author: Drew

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these for two reasons. One, I wanted to have something that was re-usable so I wasn't wasn't money and paper buying disposable nursing pads over and over again. Two, I wanted a nursing pad that was soft, copy, and discreet, which I wasn't finding with the disposable pads. These are great! They are super soft and comfortable. They stay in place and can not be seen under most clothes, nursing bras, and tanks. They also wash well. It is helpful to have the thicker pads for night time too. I highly recommend trying these out!
customer_reviews.author: L. Acey

customer_reviews.title: Softness needed when you're feeling a bit tender!
customer_reviews.text: I'm 7 weeks new to breastfeeding and have gotten to that point of tenderness where I can really tell the difference among the different nursing pads. After getting a pair with the Boob-Ease Soothing Therapy Pillows (another Bamboobies product I can't live without), I decided to get this larger pack. I couldn't deal with the roughness of the two disposable pads I tried, although they were great for absorbency. I tried organic bamboo nursing pads and none of the three different pads have had the softness my tender lady parts needed. Bamboobies did the trick. Definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: South of Market Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Great Nursing Pads
customer_reviews.text: These pads have been wonderful. The material is very soft and comfortable to wear all day. Some of the other reviews said they show through their clothes, but I haven't had that problem at all. I wear them under my nursing bra, but I suppose they might show through a cotton nursing top if you decided to go without a nursing bra. I wear the night time pads and have not had any leaks. They stay in place pretty well and do a really good job with absorbing. I love that I purchased the variety pack, it's definitely the way to go.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: super comfy!
customer_reviews.text: These are great nursing pads! I felt like I was getting scratched with the disposable pads, so I switched to these. I was hesitant to purchase since they are a little pricey, but they were well worth it! They are very soft & comfortable on the nipple! As for people complaining about the fuzz on the overnight pads, I had a few pieces stick to me, but after I washed them 2-3 times I did not have this problem. Also, the little fuzz I did have the first few times was no more than I was getting with the disposable pads.
customer_reviews.author: maf

customer_reviews.title: Great product!  Keeps you feeling dry
customer_reviews.text: These are great! They really wick away moisture and you can't even tell that you're wearing them. The overnight ones really do hold up to the big leaks while the regular ones are great for lighter leaking. They only have two drawbacks: (1)they are a little big for smaller-chested women like myself so they don't lay perfectly flat under my bra and (2)I must have had a day where I was leaking more and I leaked through the regular pads. They really are just for light leakage. Other than that, they are a great product!
customer_reviews.author: Penny L

customer_reviews.title: Soft and absorbent!
customer_reviews.text: Super soft and absorbent. Not as scratchy as those disposable ones they give you in the hospital. Extremely important for the first month when everything is messy!
customer_reviews.author: Katherine Byers

customer_reviews.title: Super soft and absorbent!!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely the softest and most absorbent of all the types of reusable nursing pads that I've bought (and I've bought several kinds!). You won't believe how super soft these get after just a single wash. I mean, they're soft to begin with, but, wow! Absolutely luxurious after one wash. The overnight ones hold a ton, too!! I have a newborn who sleeps 8 to 9 hours at night and I can make it all the way through that time without pumping and they hold all that leakage that happens. Fantastic!
customer_reviews.author: AJP

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: These are super soft and never leak, even when totally saturated (which takes a lot!!). They don't irritate my sensitive nipples, and wash really nicely. They also don't show through even the flimsiest nursing bras. If i had to complain about one thing, it would be that they do shift a bit in my shelf bra style nursing camis. They're big enough that they work anyway, though. Highly recommend- they're worth the money!
customer_reviews.author: Mae Paul

customer_reviews.title: Work great!
customer_reviews.text: They work great and this is a great value for the price. I used disposable pads for the first month postpartum, being unsure how much I would need nursing pads. I am pleased after switching to these. It sure beats having to use disposable pads and cuts down on waste. They feel quite comfortable and are concealed well under clothes. I have yet to have any issues with leaking nor does the fabric seem to stick to my skin. Overall, I am quite pleased with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Liz N

customer_reviews.title: Favorite nursing pads, worth the heafty price
customer_reviews.text: I know that a lot of people really love the disposable nursing pads, but as a cloth diapering mommy they just were not for me. Also, the disposables itch! I prefer these. They are perfect. They don't show or take up too much precious bra space. They are extremely comfortable and stay in place. Yes, if you sleep in the heart shaped ones you'll probably leak through at night, but they are perfect for day time when you are feeding often. I own quite a few and I just reserve the blue circles for night time.
customer_reviews.author: E & J

customer_reviews.title: So soft and easy to use!
customer_reviews.text: LOVE these nursing pads! I was a little nervous at first using washable pads instead of the disposable ones, but these held up just as well as the paper ones I got from my registry, plus they are way softer. I have a few pairs of these Bamboobies now so that I can cycle them through the wash and still have a stash of clean ones ready to go (plus an emergency pair in the diaper bag!). would definitely recommend the nursing pads and the nipple ointment to other new nursing moms.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Don’t think just buy!
customer_reviews.text: These are so soft and SO much better than the disposable ones. They are very comfortable and super absorbent
customer_reviews.author: Daniel J

customer_reviews.title: Great for breastfeeding & easy to wash & dry
customer_reviews.text: Great for breastfeeding & easy to wash & dry in lingerie bag. I put them on delicate wash &dry & worked great. I like soft texture & very absorbing material!!
customer_reviews.author: Megan

customer_reviews.title: Bambobies are a must have!
customer_reviews.text: Bamboobies are great! I needed something long term and sustainable after using the whole package of disposable nursing pads and Bamboobies has met my every need. I am a very heavy producer and was soaking previous pads through. I hated that I was creating so much trash with the disposable pads especially when it would be so EASY to simply wash reusables. I throw my Bamboobies in the wash with everything else. The three pair pack is more than enough to meet my needs. These are soft, eas to use, absorbent, and I will buy them for friends who are expecting in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Erin Middleton

customer_reviews.title: Leaked straight through
customer_reviews.text: I leaked through these. I woke up with the pads, my bra, and shirt soaked completely through. Very disappointing. I really wanted to love these as I hate using disposable pads, but these just don't cut it.
customer_reviews.author: Phoebe Rust

customer_reviews.title: Loving my Bamboobies!
customer_reviews.text: Love these!! I looked in the mirror one day after running errands and you could clearly see my disposable pads. It looked like I had puffy pepperoni nipples. I went on the hunt for thinner reusable pads and found these. How could all these reviews be wrong? I was skeptical but now I'm a believer! You can't see the hearts through my shirts, though you can see the overnight pads. But I only wear those at home, so I don't care. My husband can deal with it haha :)
customer_reviews.author: kayhollywood

customer_reviews.title: SO soft!
customer_reviews.text: These pads are so soft, it is a nice change from disposable. They are much larger than I expected but I'm happy to have so much coverage. Will definitely recommend them to my friends who are nursing. The hearts are nice and thin which is good for concealing but I feel like I have to change the pad as soon as there is any liquid on it. Does the job of preventing leaks on my clothing and I will just change pads regularly.
customer_reviews.author: Rodger & Candace B.

customer_reviews.title: Best nursing pads
customer_reviews.text: I've tried several other nursing pads & they have all come up short. Either they leaked through onto my shirts, were uncomfortable, or showed through my clothes. I tired Bamboobies after seeing them on Undercover Mama site. By far these are the best nursing pads out there. They are comfortable, very absorbent (I'm a heavy leaker), & hide well under my bras. I wish I had found these sooner, instead of wasting my money on all the others.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: They are super soft on sore nipples

Then, I saw the reviews on bamboobies where many people said these stay nicely in place; so I decided to give them a try. I was thrilled with how large and comfortable they are and have needed to use them earlier than I thought, started leaking while pregnant! I definitely recommend these as a go to.

customer_reviews.author: Christian Whitfill

customer_reviews.title: Love the Overnighters, The Hearts Not So Much
customer_reviews.text: The overnight heavy duty circle pads are great-- I use them during the day and at night. They are really comfortable and nicely absorbent. The hearts however can DIAF... well maybe nothing quite that serious. They're just pretty much useless. Their absorbancy wasn't that great, and they would sometimes slip to the side in my bra with their weird shape (which I'm sure was supposed to be designed for the shape of your boob) and I would leak through.
customer_reviews.author: Geri

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase for leaky boobs!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these on a friend's recommendation before I had my child, not realizing just how much you will leak when your milk comes in. I have a good supply and found that the disposable pads I got for free with other purchased items are no match to these reusable pads. Do yourself a favor and buy a pack or two...you will save so much money in the long run over disposable pads. And then go buy the boob-ease balm!
customer_reviews.author: JF

customer_reviews.title: Love the over night bamboobies
customer_reviews.text: I don't think I leak overly much, but I still find that the over night nursing pads work the best. They dry quickly, absorb what leaks, and keep me and my top dry at night. The thinner day time nursing pads work well and don't let leaks through to your shirt, but I can only wear them for short intervals. They don't dry or wick moisture away from your skin, so be prepared to change them frequently. I really like the night time ones though - I'm ordering more of just those.
customer_reviews.author: Blue Skies

customer_reviews.title: Great Nursing Pads!
customer_reviews.text: I love the texture of these. They are very soft and do not irritate the skin. The do tend to move while in the bra which causes leaks. I usually can get 3 hours out of them before having to change.
customer_reviews.author: Ricky Metz

customer_reviews.title: Holding Up Well
customer_reviews.text: I have only used these and disposable pads so I don't have much to compare them too. However, they are soft and stay put. I have soaked through them on occasion, but only when I've waited much too long to pump. They are thin enough so they don't show very much. I wash them often and tumble dry on low.
customer_reviews.author: Wangsworld

customer_reviews.title: Soft, gentle, discreet, & absorbent!
customer_reviews.text: These pads are so soft and gentle, especially on areas that become very tender due to newborn feedings. This is my 2nd time buying this product because I loved the first sets I had! Though I only have leaking issues at certain points in the day I usually wear a these are all my bras because they are so soft and on sore nipples. They are also discreet, unlike other nursing pads (disposable and thick cotton pads like "fuzzibunz"). So I feel comfortable wearing these out and about. I love these pads so much I plan to buy them for friends who are preparing for babies. I only wish "bamboobies" made nursing pads that didn't require wearing bras :0)
customer_reviews.author: Aubrey A. Huber

customer_reviews.title: I am not satisfied.

customer_reviews.author: Sheri Belle

They are wonderful because they do not soak through to my camisole (I leak a lot overnight) but do not make my skin feel wet! The Medela nursing pads are bulky and show through my camisoles and have even soaked through to my shirts overnight. I plan to spread the news to my new nursing mom friends! Thanks

Amazon gave me the option to return but I need to use them now so I chose not too, would have preferred a discount for the missing product or the missing one sent to me.
customer_reviews.author: Sara

customer_reviews.title: Very soft and more convenient than disposables

You still can't see them through a bra, though. Also, I may not leak as much as other women so the Nuk pads have been working for me as well, and those are a smaller size and fit more easily into my bras though definitely not as comfortable.
